intro: Austronea virens, commonly known as the green-flowered austronea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Austronea virens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in tropical forests.
